title: Man shot in the face in west Macon
content:
A man was shot in the face Thursday night in Macon.
According to a Bibb County Sheriff's Office news release, it happened at about 9 p.m. in the 1300 block of Courtland Avenue.
Authorities say Tyricco Simmons, 17, was handling the gun when it fired striking Marquez Jones, 18, in the face.
Jones was in stable condition at Medical Center, Navicent Health early Friday.
Simmons was booked into Bibb County jail charged with aggravated assault, according to a sheriff's office news release.
Lt. Randy Gonzalez says Jones told Simmons not to touch the gun, but he ignored him, picked it up and played with it. He says Simmons is being charged with agg assault for being reckless.
The district attorney's office will make the final decision on whether to formally charge him with that or something else.
Gonzalez says they're still investigating who owned the gun.
